page.title: 13THE UNIQUE BOW WATERWORKS
page.content: Bow Waterworks is one of the few independant water supplies in the country.The ceremony of the opening of these Waterworks took place on the 19th April,1859.One main pipe feeds 50% of the village.The rest are on South West Water.Mr.A.Jewell has been looking after the waterworks by putting in the chlorine for the last twelve years .The water from the natural springs is either pumped or runs by gravity into two storage tanks.The biggest tank is about 30ft by 40ft.and is 5ft. deep.It holds about 80,000 litres.No one knows how big the other tank is but it probably is 10x10x5ft deep.The main pump is one and a half horse power.It is electric so it does not need cleaning.There is also a spare pump in case of emergencies.
